text: In which city were the 2015 All Africa Games held?
explanation: The 11th African Games (French: 11es Jeux africains), also known as Brazzaville 2015, took place from September 4-19, 2015 in Brazzaville, Republic of the Congo. This edition marked the 50th anniversary of the Games, as well as their retur to Brazzaville, which hosted the first edition in 1965.

text: Which of these dances is performed with a masquerade costume by the Efik people?
explanation: The Ekombi dance involves masquerade costumes and is performed by the Efik people.

text: Which of these dances is performed with a masquerade costume by the Efik people?
explanation: The Ekombi dance involves masquerade costumes and is performed by the Efik people.

text: ______________ is a sudden twisting or wrenching of a joint, causing damage to ligaments.
explanation: Sprain is a common injury caused by overstretching or tearing of ligaments, often occurring in ankles and knees.

text: What is an example of a recreational activity that promotes mindfulness and relaxation?
explanation: Yoga is an example of a recreational activity that promotes mindfulness, relaxation, and physical well-being through various poses and breathing exercises.

text: When handing off the baton in a relay race, which type of take-over involves the outgoing runner seeing the incoming runner?
explanation: In a visual take-over, the outgoing runner sees the incoming runner during the baton exchange. This allows for direct eye contact and a smoother handoff.

text: Which joint is classified as a saddle joint?
explanation: The joint of the thumb, known as the carpometacarpal joint, is a saddle joint, allowing for a variety of movements.

text: Which Founding Father of Physical Education advocated for the role of play in developing character and discipline?
explanation: Clark W. Hetherington advocated for the role of play in developing character and discipline, emphasizing its importance in education and personal development through his work in physical education and recreational programs. His belief that "play is Nature's method of education" underscored his philosophy on the significance of play in human development.

text: What type of flooring is usually used for indoor basketball courts?
explanation: Hardwood flooring is commonly used for indoor basketball courts.

text: In badminton, if a player serves before the opponent is ready, what is the ruling?

options.B: The server gets an extra serve

explanation: If a player serves before the opponent is ready, the serve is replayed. This is to ensure a fair start to the rally and give both players ample time to prepare for the serve.

text:
Which basketball skill involves securing possession of missed shots or opponent's shots that come off the backboard or
rim?
explanation: Rebounding in basketball refers to the skill of securing possession of missed shots or opponent's shots that rebound off the backboard or rim. It is crucial for both offensive and defensive strategies, as it allows teams to maintain possession c prevent the opposing team from scoring second-chance points.

text: What safety equipment is essential in the hammer throw event?
explanation: A protective cage is essential in the hammer throw to ensure the safety of both athletes and spectators.

text: What is the penalty for a charging foul in basketball?

options.A: Personal foul against the defensive player
options.C: Free throws for the offensive team

explanation: A charging foul in basketball results in a turnover to the defensive team.

text: What is the role of the linesman in football?

options.C: Maintains order and discipline on the field
options.D: Signals for offside violations and throw-ins.

explanation: Linesmen (also called assistant referees) assist the main referee in spotting offside positions, throw-ins, and corner kicks

text: In the precolonial era in Nigeria, physical education was primarily influenced by:
explanation: In the precolonial era, physical education in Nigeria was largely influenced by traditional games and physical activities that were part of cultural practices.

text: Which component of physical fitness relates to the ability to change body position quickly and accurately while maintaining control and balance?
explanation: Agility is the performance/skill-related component of physical fitness that relates to the ability to change body position quickly and accurately while maintaining control and balance.

text: Name the events which make up the throwing events.

options.A: Long jump, Triple jump, High jump, Pole vault
options.B: Discus, Hammer, Pole vault, Triple jump
options.C: Shot put, Discus, Javelin, Hammer throw
options.D: Shot put, Javelin, High jump, Long jump

explanation: The throwing events include shot put, discus throw, javelin throw, and hammer throw.

text: Identify the jumping technique used in the long jump.
explanation: The hitch-kick is a technique that involves a single or double arm and leg action in the air to maximize hang time and distance in the long jump. It helps the jumper project their body forward and maintain momentum after take-off.

text: How can carrying heavy bags or backpacks contribute to postural problems?

options.B: By causing muscle imbalances and strain on the spine.
options.C: By evenly distributing weight on both shoulders.
options.D: By reducing the load on the back muscles

explanation: Carrying heavy bags with improper posture can lead to muscle imbalances, back pain, and postural deviations.

text: In football, which skill involves intercepting or stopping the ball carrier from advancing with the ball?
explanation: Tackling in football refers to the skill of intercepting the ball or stopping the opponent's progress by tackling them legally to regain possession or prevent scoring opportunities.

text: In table tennis, what skill involves hitting the ball back and forth with the opponent?
explanation: Rallies involve hitting the ball back and forth with the opponent.

text: Which physical fitness component is directly associated with body fat reduction?
explanation: Cardiovascular endurance activities like running, swimming, and cycling help burn calories and increase metabolism, leading to fat loss.

text: How does physical activity contribute to social well-being?

options.B: By fostering social connections and relationships
options.D: By reducing opportunities for social gatherings

explanation: Physical activity fosters social connections and relationships by providing opportunities for interaction and shared experiences, thereby promoting social well-being.

text: Which nutrient class is primarily responsible for providing structure to cells and supporting growth and development?
explanation: Proteins provide structure to cells and tissues, supporting growth, repair, and development throughout the body.

text: Which of the following hurdle races requires the athlete to jump over water barriers?
explanation: The 3000 meters steeplechase is the event that includes water barriers. Athletes must jump over both regular hurdles and water jumps.

text: What method of maintaining personal health emphasizes consuming a balanced diet that includes fruits, vegetables, proteins, and whole grains?
explanation: Nutrition plays a crucial role in maintaining personal health by providing essential nutrients for bodily functions and overall well-being.

text: Which national competition aims to promote grassroots football development in Nigeria?
explanation: The National Principals Cup aims to promote grassroots football development in Nigeria.

text: In a relay race, how wide is the designated take-over zone?
explanation: The designated take-over zone in a relay race is 20 meters long. This is the area where the baton must be exchanged between runners.

text: Which organ is part of the lymphatic system and helps in the immune response?
explanation: The spleen is part of the lymphatic system and plays a role in immune response and filtering blood.

text: Which postural defect involves an abnormal lateral curvature of the spine, usually occurring during growth spurts or adolescence?
explanation: Scoliosis is characterized by an abnormal lateral curvature of the spine, often detected during growth spurts or adolescence.

text: Which nutrient class is essential for maintaining healthy vision, skin, and mucous membranes?
explanation: Vitamins such as vitamin A are essential for maintaining healthy vision, skin, and mucous membranes, supporting immune function and overall health.

text: How does the scope of Physical Education extend beyond physical fitness?

options.A: It promotes social interaction and communication skills.
options.B: It teaches advanced anatomy and physiology.
options.C: It offers in-depth training for competitive sports.
options.D: It focuses solely on building muscle strength.

explanation: Physical Education (PE) extends beyond physical fitness by promoting social interaction and communication skills, along with physical development. It emphasizes holistic development rather than just focusing on physical strength or academic subjects.

text: In a sprint race, what is the most common starting position?
explanation: The most common starting position in a sprint race is the crouching start. This position allows for a powerful and explosive start, maximizing acceleration.

text: What is the standard height of a badminton net?
explanation: The badminton court has two halves measuring 6.7m (22 feet) each and separated by a badminton net that stands at a height of 1.55m (5 feet 1in) at the ends and dips to 1.52m (5 feet) in the middle.

text: Why is leisure important for mental health?

options.A: Leisure provides a break from routine and promotes relaxation.
options.B: Leisure has no impact on mental health.
options.D: Leisure is only beneficial for physically demanding jobs.

explanation: Engaging in leisure activities can reduce stress, improve mood, and enhance overall mental well-being.

text: Which muscle aids in the movement of the hip and thigh and is located in the groin area?
explanation: The Iliopsoas muscle is a crucial muscle group that aids in the movement of the hip and thigh. It's composed of two muscles, the iliacus and the psoas major, which work together to flex the hip joint.

text: What type of community health service is most likely to use modern diagnostic equipment?
explanation: Orthodox health services are most likely to use modern diagnostic equipment.Orthodox health services are grounded in scientific principles and often incorporate advanced medical technologies for accurate diagnosis and treatment. This includes a wide range of equipment, such as X-ray machines, ultrasound scanners MRI machines, and blood testing equipment. These tools enable healthcare professionals to identify and assess health conditions effectively, leading to appropriate treatment plans.

text: Why is open communication about sex and relationships crucial in a family?
explanation: Open communication about sex and relationships strengthens family bonds by fostering trust and understanding, and providing accurate information.

text: In ancient Greece, physical education was linked to:

options.A: Military training and preparation for war

explanation: In ancient Greece, physical education was primarily linked to military training and preparation for war. It emphasized the development of physical fitness and athletic prowess to prepare citizens for military service and defense of the city-states.

text: How is the administrative structure of the IOC organized?

options.B: President, Secretary-General, and Board of Directors

explanation: The IOC is organized with a President, Secretary-General, and Board of Directors.

text: What is the full meaning of NIPOGA?
explanation: NIPOGA stands for Nigerian Polytechnic Games Association.

text: How does dance influence cognitive development in children?

options.A: It exerts no measurable influence on cognitive functions
options.B: It primarily affects physical coordination without impacting cognition
options.C: It disrupts cognitive processing by distracting attention
options.D: It enhances memory retention and cognitive flexibility

explanation: Dance has been shown to enhance cognitive development by improving memory retention and cognitive flexibility through the learning and execution of complex movements and routines.

text: Which test is commonly used during an eye screening to assess visual acuity?
explanation: The Snellen chart is a tool used to measure visual acuity during eye screenings.

text: What is the classification of diseases like tuberculosis and leprosy?
explanation: Tuberculosis and leprosy are bacterial diseases caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis and Mycobacterium leprae, respectively.

text: Which of the following is a key principle of first aid?
explanation: Acting calmly and confidently is essential to effectively administer first aid.

text: Which of the following is a common factor contributing to drug abuse?
explanation: All the listed factors, including peer pressure, low self-esteem, and family history of drug abuse, commonly contribute tc the risk of drug abuse.

text: Which item in a first aid box helps to stop bleeding from a wound?
explanation: Sterile gauze is used to cover wounds and help control bleeding by providing a barrier that can absorb blood and promote clotting

text: What is the first step in managing a severe bleeding wound?
explanation: Applying direct pressure to the wound helps control bleeding by reducing blood flow and allowing clotting.

text: What is a common feature of the traditional attire worn during the Eyo Festival dance?
explanation: During the Eyo Festival dance, traditional robes and headgear are commonly worn.

text: Which of the following is a healthy fat source in a balanced diet?
explanation: Monounsaturated fats are considered healthy fats and are beneficial for heart health.They can help lower bad cholesterol levels and reduce the risk of heart disease. Sources of monounsaturated fats include avocados, nuts, olive oil, and fatty fish.

text: What deficiency causes muscle cramps and is treated by increasing dietary intake of which mineral?
explanation: Muscle cramps can result from potassium deficiency. Increasing potassium intake helps alleviate cramps.

text: Which of the following bodily functions relies heavily on adequate water intake?
explanation: Water is crucial for maintaining adequate blood volume and circulation throughout the body.

text: What is the target heart rate zone for aerobic exercise?
explanation: The target heart rate zone for aerobic exercise is 70-85% of the maximum heart rate to ensure effective cardiovascular training.

text: First aid training is important because it:

options.B: Reduces the risk of injury altogether
options.C: Eliminates the need for professional medical care
options.D: Prepares individuals to act in emergencies

explanation: First aid training equips individuals with the skills needed to handle emergencies effectively.

text: Cardiovascular fitness refers to:

options.A: The ability to move joints through a full range of motion
options.C: The ability to perform prolonged physical activity
options.D: The ability to lift heavy weights

explanation: Cardiovascular fitness is the capacity of the heart and lungs to supply oxygen to the body during sustained physical activity, which enables prolonged exercise or physical activity.

text: Which city-state in ancient Greece was known for its militaristic approach to physical education?
explanation: Sparta was renowned for its militaristic society and placed a strong emphasis on physical education as a means of training its citizens for warfare. While Athens also valued physical fitness, its approach was more balanced, incorporation intellectual and artistic pursuits alongside physical training.

text: How can self-medication lead to drug misuse?

options.A: By causing incorrect dosages to be taken
options.C: By increasing the effectiveness of the drug
options.D: By ensuring proper use of medication

explanation: Self-medication can lead to taking incorrect dosages, which is a form of drug misuse.

text: Which of the following is NOT a cause of drug misuse?

options.A: Lack of knowledge about proper dosage
options.C: Trying to self-treat a medical condition

explanation: Intentional recreational use is usually classified as drug abuse, not misuse. Misuse generally involves improper use of prescribed or over-the-counter medications due to lack of knowledge, self-treatment attempts, or misunderstanding instructions.

text: Which type of exercise is beneficial for improving balance in individuals with neurological disorders?

options.B: Balance exercises on a stability ball

explanation: Balance exercises on a stability ball help improve proprioception and stability, which is beneficial for individuals with neurological disorders.

text: The part of the heart marked 2 is the
explanation: The part of the heart marked 2 is the Superior vena cavaSuperior vena cava- It is one of the two venae cavae.- It is one of the great Venous trunks.- it helps in returning the Deoxygenated blood from the systemic circulation to the Right Atrium.- it helps in receiving the Venous return from the head of the body.

text: What is the primary difference between refuse and sewage?

options.A: Refuse is generated by animals; sewage is generated by plants
options.B: Refuse is biodegradable; sewage is non-biodegradable
options.C: Refuse is liquid waste; sewage is solid waste
options.D: Refuse is solid waste; sewage is liquid waste

explanation: Refuse refers to solid waste materials such as garbage, paper, plastic, and other discarded items.Sewage, on the other hand, is primarily liquid waste consisting of wastewater from households, industries, and othersources.

text: What does NATCEGA stand for?

options.A: National Association of Colleges and Education Games Administration
options.B: National Association of Teachers of Colleges and Education Games
options.C: Nigeria advanced Teacher's Colleges and College of Education Games Association
options.D: National Association of Technical Colleges Education Games Association

explanation: NATCEGA is the acronym for the Nigeria advanced Teacher's Colleges and College of Education Games Association, which organizes sporting competitions among colleges of education in Nigeria.

text: Which muscle is known for its role in the movement of the jaw and chewing?
explanation: The masseter muscle is crucial for chewing and moving the jaw.

text: What is a key aspect of ensuring electrical safety at home?
explanation: Regularly checking for frayed wires helps prevent electrical fires and accidents, ensuring a safe home environment.

text: In the case of a nosebleed, what should you do?

options.A: Apply a hot compress to the nose
options.D: Pinch the nostrils and lean forward

explanation: Pinch the nostrils and lean forward.This is the correct first aid response for a nosebleed. Pinching the nostrils applies pressure to the bleeding point, while leaning forward prevents blood from draining into the throat.

text: Which of the following is a common benefit of a proper warm-up?
explanation: A proper warm-up increases muscle flexibility, reducing the risk of injury.

text: Which mineral deficiency is associated with muscle weakness and is corrected by increasing intake of which mineral?
explanation: Magnesium is crucial for numerous bodily functions, including muscle and nerve function. A deficiency can manifest as muscle weakness, cramps, and fatigue. Increasing magnesium intake through diet or supplements can help alleviate these symptoms.

text: Health education promotes:
explanation: Health education aims to empower individuals with knowledge and skills for lifelong health and well-being, encouraging continuous learning and proactive health management.

text: Which of the following is a common posture issue associated with endomorphs?
explanation: Lordosis, also known as swayback, is a common postural issue associated with endomorphs. It's characterized by an inward curve of the lower back, often resulting from excess weight and a weak core.

text: What is the importance of using sunscreen daily?

options.A: It is not necessary unless at the beach
options.C: It causes the skin to age faster
options.D: It prevents skin damage from UV rays

explanation: Sunscreen protects the skin from harmful UV rays, reducing the risk of sunburn and skin cancer.

text: Which structure in the central nervous system is responsible for transmitting sensory and motor signals between the brain and the rest of the body?
explanation: The spinal cord transmits sensory and motor signals between the brain and the rest of the body, playing a crucial role in the CNS.

text: Which cell organelle is responsible for protein synthesis?
explanation: Ribosomes are responsible for synthesizing proteins by translating genetic instructions from mRNA.

text: Which factor is most likely to decrease flexibility over time?
explanation: A sedentary lifestyle, characterized by minimal physical activity, is most likely to decrease flexibility over time. Lack of movement can lead to tight muscles and reduced joint mobility, limiting flexibility.

text: Which muscle helps in the movement of the shoulder and is known as the shoulder pad?
explanation: The deltoid muscle is the prominent muscle forming the rounded contour of the shoulder. It's often referred to as the "shoulder pad" due to its shape and location.

text: What is the purpose of the cartilage rings in the trachea?
explanation: The cartilage rings provide structural support, preventing the trachea from collapsing and ensuring a clear airway for breathing.

text: Which dance step involves high leaps and kicks and is associated with the Yoruba people?
explanation: The Bata dance, associated with the Yoruba people, features high leaps and kicks.

text: What does NUGA stand for?
explanation: NUGA stands for National University Games Association, which organizes sports competitions among universities in Nigeria.

text: What is the primary difference between strength training and power training?

options.A: Strength training requires no equipment, while power training uses weights
options.B: Strength training aims to increase muscle size, while power training focuses on explosive strength
options.C: Strength training focuses on high reps, while power training focuses on low reps
options.D: Strength training and power training are the same

explanation: While both strength training and power training involve lifting weights, they have different goals.Strength training emphasizes building muscle mass and endurance, typically using heavier weights with fewer repetitions. Power training, on the other hand, aims to improve the ability to generate force quickly, often using lighter weights with explosive movements.

text: Which medication class is commonly used to treat epilepsy?
explanation: Anticonvulsants, also known as antiepileptic drugs (AEDs), are medications specifically designed to treat seizures associated with epilepsy.They work by balancing the electrical activity in the brain, reducing the likelihood of seizures occurring.

text: What is a direct benefit of maintaining good mental health?

options.A: Increased incidence of mental health disorders

explanation: Maintaining good mental health leads to improved emotional stability and resilience against stress.
